content:
• Thursday, August 29, 2013
  • KOOL

    ThermoGenesis posts bigger FQ4 loses Y/Y; revenue lower

    • ThermoGenesis (NASDAQ:KOOL) posts an FQ4 loss of $0.14 per share on revenues of $4.1M. This compares to a loss per share of $0.04 on revenues of $4.5M in the same quarter a year ago.
    • No analyst estimates were available for comparison. (PR)
    • Shares +1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • OVTI

    More on OmniVision FQ1 results, guidance

    • OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) shares are taking a beating, down 10.3% AH after the company released mixed FQ1 results and lower-than-expected guidance. FQ2 revenue is expected to be $375M-$410M (consensus of $406.6M) and EPS is forecast to be $0.36-$0.53 (consensus of $0.49).
    • CEO Shaw Hong: "[A]s competition intensified in response to the market slowdown, the forecasts for some of our products were negatively affected."
    • Gross margin fell to 17.4% in FQ1 from 19.1% in FQ1 2012.
    • Opex as a % of revenue fell to 12.9% in FQ1 from 19.3% in FQ1 2012. Hong: "We continue to pursue cost reductions across our supply chain."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM

  • After-hours top gainers / losers

    • After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CRM +8%. SPLK +5%. MITL +5%. TSPT +3%. BPZ +3%.
    • After-hours top losers: KKD -12%. MNKD -12%. OVTI -10%. MUX -7%. OTC:BEBE -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 6 Comments
  • BONA

    Bona Film Group beats by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • Bona Film Group (NASDAQ:BONA): Q2 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $28.3M misses by $5.5M. Shares +4.89% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk +6% AH after beating Q2 estimates, raising full-year guidance

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) +6% AH after Q2 results beat expectations, though its loss widened on sharply higher stock-based compensation expenses.
    • Issues in-line guidance for Q3, seeing revenues of $69M-$71M vs. $69.5M analyst consensus; issues upside guidance for FY 2014, seeing revenues of $275M-$281M vs. $275M consensus.
    • Revenue jumped 50% to $66.9M, above its estimate of $61M-$63M; license revenue rose 43% while maintenance and services revenue jumped 66%.
    • SPLK has never posted a quarterly profit, though its customer base is growing; it signed more than 400 new enterprise customers in Q2, ending with a total of more than 6,000 customers worldwide.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTRL

    Control4 misses by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Control4 (NASDAQ:CTRL): Q2 EPS of $0.08 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $32.5M beats by $0.22M. Shares -3.36% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme melts on bottom line miss, tepid guidance

    • Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD) aren't looking too sweet after hours, falling 11% as merely affirming EPS guidance is apparently no longer sufficient to keep the market happy — especially when you come up two pennies short of consensus on the bottom line. (Q2 results)
    • Same-store sales jump 10% for the quarter, the nineteenth straight time comps have been positive. "Our dramatic same store sales gain was driven primarily through higher traffic counts as customers found more reasons to treat themselves to our unique products," CEO James Morgan says.
    • Revenue and adjusted net income rise 10.4% and 17.2% respectively in Q2.
    • FY14 outlook: EPS of $0.59-0.63 against consensus of $0.64. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • OVTI

    OmniVision beats by $0.12, misses on revenue

    • OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $373.7M misses by $2.88M. Shares -10.59% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRM

    Salesforce jumps AH on beat and raise

    • Shares of Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) are up 7.1% AH (adding to an intraday gain of +2%) after the company beat Q2 expectations and guided for Q3 revenue of $1.05B-$1.055B (consensus of $1.04B) and EPS of $0.08-$0.09 (consensus of $0.07).
    • FY 2014 revenue is projected to be $4B-$4.025B (consensus of $3.99B) and EPS is expected to be $0.32-$0.34 (consensus of $0.33).
    • A caveat: FCF declined 24.6% Y/Y to $80.6M. Operating cash flow was up 34.5% Y/Y to $183.2M, outpaced by a capex surge of 249.9% to $102.5M.
    • Conference call at 5pm ET
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • MITL

    Mitel Networks beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Mitel Networks (NASDAQ:MITL): FQ1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $141.6M misses by $1.9M. Shares +10.62% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q2 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $215.2M misses by $0.54M. Shares -8.16% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme misses by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Krispy Kreme (KKD): Q2 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $112.7M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $1.34M. Shares -9.21% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • GAME

    Shanda Games gets walloped as market takes in Q2 results, guidance

    • Shanda Games (GAME -10.1%) gets walloped as the market takes in the company's Q2 results and guidance.
    • The most vocal worry? its new G-Home platform will be marginalized by the app stores of larger players like Baidu, Tencent, and Qihoo.
    • The reversal from up 6.6% AH yesterday to down 10.6% today is not uncommon for GAME, which has seen its fair share of volatility in the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK): Q2 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $66.9M (+50% Y/Y) beats by $3.93M. Shares +5.29% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): Q2 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $957M beats by $18.5M. Shares +7.06% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 12 Comments
  • CVV

    CVD equipment plunges after bearish SA piece

    • CVD Equipment (CVV -15%) crumbles after SA author Alpha Exposure says the stock faces an "imminent and substantial collapse." Not only is the promise of graphene developments a mirage and too far in the future for CVD to benefit, but it faces growing competition from players like Apple, Lockheed Martin, and BASF, writes the author. The fair value of CVD is $5 per share vs. $14.65 at the time of the article's publishing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks no walking dead, B. Riley lifts shares to Buy

    • AMC Networks' (AMCX +3.5%) 15% pullback after its Q2 earnings provides an attractive entry point for investors, B. Riley says in upgrading shares to Buy from Neutral and raising its price target to $76 from $65.
    • The firm says the market has priced in a worst-case scenario of cancellation of new series "Low Winter Sun" and is ignoring any possible upside from other new shows and fourth season of "The Walking Dead."
    • AMC's free cash flow generation is a positive and "most important metric for names like AMCX given such a low cap-ex business model," the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • MPWR

    Monolithic Power hits 52-week high after Stifel ups price target

    • Shares of Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR +4.9%) hit 52-week highs after Stifel Nicolaus raises its price target to $34 from $32, noting that "building a brand in analog takes a long time, but [Monolithic] has transformed its culture in the last three years to be a force in the industry."
    • From its discussions with management, Stifel says it is apparent that MPWR continues to experience solid momentum while penetrating new markets, even as it stabilizes its consumer business in 2013.
    • Stifel expects MPWR's revenue to outpace expenses by a significant margin, leading to a potential operating margin of 25%-30% in late 2014 or early 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • ABB

    ABB cut to Underweight at HSBC

    • ABB (ABB -1.5%) dips after HSBC Securities cut the shares to an Underweight rating from Neutral on valuation. Price target information was not available.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax shares rise and fall amid Omontys debate

    • It's been another eventful session for shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4.6%) after Seeking Alpha contributor EXPstocktrader helped the stock's cause by advising  investors not to "confuse the word 'recall' to mean canceled or revoked" in reference to the company's anemia drug Omontys.
    • The shares were trading up around 10% before SA contributor Alpha Exposure (whose article appears to have contributed to yesterday's rout) penned a fresh piece reiterating the position that "Omontys is unlikely to be approved to return to market and that Affymax's stock will probably be worthless."
    • AFFY pared gains midday and is now trading moderately higher, but still off considerably from Monday's close.
    • Yesterday: AFFY tumbles
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow continues run; Canaccord positive on StreetEasy acquisition

    • Shares of Zillow (Z +9.1%) continue to run after the real estate portal closed its acquisition of StreetEasy yesterday.
    • Canaccord's Michael Graham cast the acquisition in a positive light, noting that StreetEasy's "unique data offering" in the NYC market "differentiates Zillow further in the competitive landscape." Graham believes the start-up, whose financials were not disclosed, is EBITDA positive. Canaccord maintains its Hold rating on Zillow and a PT of $90.
    • Z has reversed losses after its $205M secondary offering and is up 31% in Aug.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • STX

    Seagate, Western Digital sink

    • Shares of Seagate (STX -2.8%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.1%) are trading notably lower on the session.
    • According to CNBC, the move may be attributable to a note out today from Cleveland Research.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals publishes encouraging Phase I results from its amyloidosis research

    • Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +2.5%) gains after publishing Phase I trial data showing RNAi therapeutics targeting transthyretin achieved rapid, dose-dependent, durable, and specific knockdown of the disease-causing protein in TTR-mediated amyloidosis.
    • The findings were published today in the New England Journal of Medicine and suggest that the sustained knockdown of TTR levels observed in clinical trials with ALN-TTR02 may ameliorate the course of disease in patients with ATTR.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • MU

    Micron rallies on positive Jefferies investor day comments

    • Micron Technology (MU +3%) shares are strong after positive comments emerge from a Jefferies investor day.
    • MU believes it is unlikely to see the effect of recent declines in NAND contract prices reported by DRAMeXchange, Jefferies reports; MU also is seeing stable DRAM prices and is confident of continued stability in DRAM prices.
    • The firm recommends buying MU "while investors are still not fully convinced of structurally positive fundamentals in DRAM and NAND"; it also offers favorable comments on AMD (AMD -1%), NXP Semiconductors (NXPI +2%) and Xilinx (XLNX +1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • SWY

    Grocery store and drugstore stocks pick up buyers

    • A mix of economic news is lifting select grocery and drugstore stocks as the sector gets another look amid broad concerns over consumer spending.
    • Advancers: SWY +1.4%, KR +1.2%, WFM +1.7%, NGVC +3.5%, WAG +1.5%, RAD +2.5%, CVS +1.2%, VSI +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • PDH

    PetroLogistics price target cut to $15 at Cowen

    • PetroLogistics' (PDH -2.3%) price target is cut to $15 from $17 at Cowen on slight margin compression.
    • Cowen sees the propane-propylene spread remaining at favorable levels despite compression from increases in propane prices; it looks forward to marginal capacity increases from the catalyst turnaround.
    • The firm lowers its 2013 distribution estimate to $1.59/unit, EPS to $1.44/unit and EBITDA to $264M (prior: $1.71/unit, $1.56/unit and $281M, respectively) due mostly to lower volume and margin expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • STML

    Jefferies initiates Stemline Therapeutics with a Buy; shares higher

    • Stemline Therapeutics (STML +5.7%) moves up today after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy and a hefty $60 price target.
    • Jefferies says that STML's lead drug, SL-401, is entering pivotal trials in 2014 for the treatment of BPDCN, a rare lymphoma, and third-line acute myeloid leukemia.
    • The firm views response rates in both settings as robust, including durable complete responses, after a single cycle of treatment, and believes that even better efficacy could be achieved with multiple SL-401 cycles. It estimates SL-401 peak sales of over $500M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • MWW

    Buyback chatter lifting Monster Worldwide

    • A vibrant rally in Monster Worldwide (MWW +8.9%) can be partially attributed to speculation that the company will buy back more shares on the open market.
    • Shares have been stagnant since Monster's Q2 earnings underwhelmed and July's job report came in below expectations to set a negative tone for employment firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity raising more cash to finance expansion

    • Hungry for more cash to finance the expansion of its burgeoning solar installation business, SolarCity (SCTY +3.1%) is planning to sell $94-$108M worth of stock (2.8M-3.2M shares at $33.69, above SolarCity's current trading price), and issue $100M worth of convertible senior notes due 2018 ($115M if an overallotment option is fully exercised). (S-1s: I, II)
    • SolarCity announced a $175M convertible debt offering in June. Shortly before that, the company obtained a $100M loan to help finance panel installations, and reached a $500M+ financing deal with Goldman.
    • SolarCity had $271.4M in debt on its balance sheet at the end of Q2, and $165.6M in cash/equivalents. The company recently announced it's buying channel partner Paramount Solar for $120M, but that deal is mostly being paid for with stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 8 Comments
  • CRUS

    Cirrus adds to Wednesday gains following Sterne Agee note

    • Cirrus Logic (CRUS +5%) is now up 15% from Tuesday's close. Shares took off yesterday in response to fellow Apple supplier Avago's strong results and guidance, and an upgrade to Buy from Feltl & Co. Today, Sterne Agee has joined the list of firms arguing Avago's numbers are a positive for Cirrus.
    • Apple accounts for over 2/3 of Cirrus' revenue. The pending arrival of a cheaper iPhone (reportedly called the 5C) stands to increase Apple's iPhone unit volumes, and thus (assuming, as is widely believed, a Cirrus audio codec chip has been designed into the phone) Cirrus' sales to Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: MEI +33%. PRCP +25%. EGAN +18%. DGLY +18%. ACST +14%. GES +12%. LRN +12%. CPRX +11%. REDF +11%. MUX +11%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: TFM -10%. GCO -9%. CVV -8%. MY -8%. SBLK -8%. AEHR -7%. DHRM -7%. MTEX -7%. CIMT -7%. VSCP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • XOM

    Energy stocks slide after two-day rally as oil prices drop

    • With strikes on Syria no sure thing now, oil prices have fallen nearly 1% and taken oil stocks with them; in fact, energy (XLE -0.6%) and utilities (XLU -0.7%) are the only S&P sectors in the red.
    • Among global producers: XOM -1.2%, CVX -0.7%, COP -0.6%, RDS.A -0.6%, BP -0.9%, TOT -1.6%.
    • Notable decliners: CNX -2.4%, RRC -2.1%.
    • Refiners are among energy stocks bucking the sector's downward trend: VLO +0.7%, TSO +0.9%, PSX +0.6%, MPC +0.8%, WNR +1.5%, HFC +2.3%, ALJ +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters pops on new buyback authorization

    • Urban Outfitters (URBN +2.1%) rises after the company's board authorizes $10M in additional share repurchases. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • RCI

    Canadian carriers rally following Vodafone/Verizon news

    • Rogers (RCI +2.8%), BCE (BCE +1.9%), and Telus (TU +2.8%) are all posting solid gains after Bloomberg reported Verizon is in advanced talks to buy Vodafone's 45% Verizon Wireless stake for $130B and plans to partly finance the deal by raising $60B in debt, and Vodafone subsequently confirmed it's talking to Big Red.
    • Investors are betting the deal's enormous price tag will make Verizon (VZ +3.4%) hold off on its Canadian expansion plans for now. Verizon already had $49.8B in debt on its balance sheet at the end of Q2, offset only a little by $5.7B in cash/investments.
    • The Globe and Mail recently reported Verizon has decided to hold off on making bids for smaller Canadian carriers until a January spectrum auction concludes.
    • Meanwhile, Nomura believes even a $130B deal for Vodafone's stake would be accretive for Verizon, since it would still only value Verizon Wireless at 8.5x 2013E EBITDA. The firm thinks Verizon would trade at 7x 2014E EBITDA and 2.3x net debt/EBITDA (a ratio deemed "manageable") following a $130B deal half-paid in cash.
    • Judging by today's move in Verizon shares, investors also think the positives outweigh the negatives. Is Verizon getting a good deal on a premium asset - while Verizon's wireline revenue continues to slowly decline, Verizon Wireless is still growing and gaining share - or is Vodafone smartly selling high as U.S. mobile growth slows and competition intensifies?
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • AAL

    More on airline stocks and the US Airways-American merger

    • A research note from Buckingham Research dissects the recent development that the Department of Justice will work toward a settlement with US Airways (LCC +4.2%) and American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK).
    • Analyst Dan McKenzie calls a quick deal "highly unlikely" because of the high concessions the DOJ is asking for and the difficulty in getting six state AGs and the District of Columbia to sign off.
    • If Buckingham is right, today's airline stock rally (DAL, UAL, LUV, SAVE, ALGT, JBLU) could be a bit hasty.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • OGXPY

    OGX Petroleo tumbles on debt swap, Petronas backtracking, cash crunch

    • Shares of OGX Petroleo (OTCPK:OGXPY -14.2%) are plummeting on reports that OGX's beleaguered controlling shareholder,  Eike Batista, will swap $3.6B in bonds for equity and give up his controlling position in the company.
    • OGX's $850M deal to sell a stake in its Tubarao Martelo field to Malaysian Petronas has started to crack. As the field fails to live up to expectations, Petronas is attempting to back out of the deal, a move OGX insists it "no right" to before OGX completes its restructuring.
    • Although the debt conversion would dilute shareholders, it may be the only option to ease OGX's cash crunch. Analysts speculate the company may run out of cash before year end because of interest payments and drilling costs.
    • Shares are down 32.3% this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Labs gains on a solid FQ3 earnings beat

    • Bio-Reference Labs (BRLI +3%) moves up on a solid FQ3 earnings beat today.
    • Total revenue rose to $185,427, +16% from the same quarter last year and the highest recorded in a quarter in corporate history.
    • Net income increased by 17%.
    • Revenue per patient was $85.25, an increase of 7% over the $79.75 in the prior year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • TUR

    Stocks rally in Turkey, July trade deficit wider than expected

    • Turkish stocks (TUR +2.5%) join an emerging markets relief rally, rising 1.4% as fears of an immediate Western strike on Syria subside a bit.
    • The Borsa Instanbul jumps 942, bouncing off twelve-month lows, while the lira joins the rupee in firming against the dollar. The yield on benchmark 2-year bonds falls 18 bps.
    • The country's trade deficit for July prints at $9.81B, above economists' estimates of $8.7B — exports to the Middle East fell 30% Y/Y for the month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals signs an R&D accord with the National Cancer Institute for its Lymphoma treatment

    • Idera Pharmaceuticals (IDRA -2.7%) gives back all of a 9% pre-market spike, plus more, as investors take advantage of some positive news to lock in big profits.
    • Earlier this morning the company said it's reached an R&D accord with the National Cancer Institute to evaluate its Toll-like receptor antagonists as a potential approach to the treatment of certain genetically defined B-cell lymphomas.
    • The stock has soared over 170% since late July on heavy volume, hitting new 52-week highs nearly every week, which has apparently put the stock into "sell-the-news" mode at current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • AUDC

    AudiCodes rallies thanks to Oppenheimer note; peers also up

    • Oppenheimer's Andrew Uerkwitz has raised his AudioCodes (AUDC +3.6%) PT to $7 (1.6x 2014E EV/sales) from $5, while reiterating an Outperform.
    • Uerkwitz thinks AudioCodes will see meaningful margin expansion in 2014, predicts the adoption of VoIP solutions leveraging Microsoft Lync will accelerate next year (SA contributor Josh Franklin recently touched on AudioCodes' ability to benefit from Lync deployments), and thinks the company could be an M&A target over the long-term.
    • VoIP infrastructure peers Sonus (SONS +2.1%) and BroadSoft (BSFT +2.2%) are up in sympathy.
    • AudioCodes rallied a month ago after beating Q2 estimates and issuing strong 2013 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide rallies as sentiment improves

    • Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +5.4%) move higher as traders call the stock oversold on both technical and fundamental factors.
    • Short interest on the stock has fallen considerably during the course of the year although with the volatile volume spikes in Monster the bull vs. bear battle is still ongoing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • CSH

    Cash America upgraded, shares rise

    • Cash America (CSH +3.4%) pops as FBR upgrades the shares to Outperform from Market Perform citing decreased competition and the likelihood of accelerated growth.
    • Price target is $50.
    • In another recent upgrade, Janney Montgomery said the stock trades at an "excessive discount" as payday regulation concerns are largely priced in.
    • See also: SA contributor Paulo Santos says "temporary hardship" has created an opportunity in the shares as "the business is still growing quickly and would otherwise merit a premium valuation."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • MEI

    Methode Electronics skyrockets on FQ1 beat, raised guidance

    • Shares of Methode Electronics (MEI +32.6%) are skyrocketing after the company's FQ1 results beat consensus on revenue and earnings handily.
    • Methode also hiked FY 2014 guidance to revenue of $670M-$700M (consensus of $653.3M) and EPS of $1.40-$1.60 (consensus of $1.05). (PR)
    • MEI is up 161.5% in the last year on a long string of topping expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • NBIX

    AbbVie initiates second Phase 3 trial of Neurocrine's elagolix

    • Neurocrine Biosciences (NBIX +3.8%) says AbbVie (ABBV) has launched a second Phase 3 trial of elagolix in endometriosis.
    • Data from the first Phase 3 study is due in Q3 2014.
    • NBIX expects to file an NDA in 2016. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • RPTP

    Raptor Pharmaceutical sinks following bearish article

    • Raptor Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:RPTP) drops 5.7% to $12.02 following a bearish piece on Seeking Alpha by Gravity Research, which has given the stock a price target of below $4 after initiating coverage.
    • Gravity Research reckons that the most that Raptor can expect to generate from its flagship drug Procysbi, which the FDA recently approved for treating nephropathic cystinosis, is "less than $4/share even under ideal conditions"
    • Gravity Research also "assigns zero value to Raptor's pipeline due to strong evidence that the fundamental theories behind its leading indications are flawed."
    • Nephropathic cystinosis is a rare genetic disorder "that causes the amino acid cystine to accumulate in every cell of the body, leading to kidney problems and the loss of too much sugar, proteins, and salt through the urine." (Medscape)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • INFY

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes

    • Infosys (INFY +0.1%) has been upgraded to Outperform, and Wipro (WIT +0.3%) to Neutral, by Macquarie.
    • AutoNavi (AMAP -1%) has received a two-notch downgrade to Underperform from Macquarie, and a downgrade to Hold from Deutsche, following its Q2 miss and decision to stop providing guidance.
    • Vodafone (VOD +8.3%) has been started at Sell by SocGen. Investors are more interested in other news.
    • SMI (SMI +2.8%) has been upgraded to Market Perform by Bernstein.
    • LTX-Credence (LTXC -1.4%) has been cut to Hold by Craig-Hallum a day after providing soft guidance to go with its FQ4 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola to provide U.K.'s Lighthouse Energy with solar modules

    • ReneSola (NYSE:SOL) agrees to provide Lightsource Renewable Energy, the U.K.'s largest solar energy generator, with 69.5 MW of solar modules for installation on solar farms in the country.
    • Once installed, the modules are expected to generate enough clean electricity to power more than 23K U.K. households.
    • SOL +6% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview

    • U.S. stock futures are higher but don't seem to have reacted to too much to the upward revision in Q2 GDP data.
    • The Dow Mini +0.3%, the S&P is +0.2% and the Nasdaq is +0.3%.
    • A possible delay to any action against Syria is cited as the reason for a rise in global equities earlier, although Europe has turned mixed.
    • Vodafone is +8.6% on news that it's in talks to sell a key cash cow, the 45% it owns in Verizon Wireless. Prospective buyer Verizon Communications is +5%.
    • Guess? jumps 11.35% following Q2 earnings.
    • Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Fed's James Bullard
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Premarket Gainers: PRCP +31%. UNIS +16%. GES +12%. VOD +9%. SLT +7%. VZ +5%.
    • Losers: RPTP -9%. CIMT -8%. TFM -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • PRCP

    Perceptron skyrockets after Q4 results

    • Shares of Perceptron (NASDAQ:PRCP) rally 32% premarket following an upbeat FQ4 report Wednesday evening.
    • Revenue rose 62% Y/Y for the quarter.
    • Gross margin came in at 48.1%.

    • "2013 was a very good year for the company [as] continuing business exceeded $60M in sales for the first time, gross margin improved, and operating income improved both in total dollars and as a percent of sales," CEO Harry Rittenour said. (PR)

  • ALVR

    Alvarion spikes PM following improved offer from Valley Telecom

    • Alvarion shares (NASDAQ:ALVR) are up 42.6% PM after the company's Receiver submitted an improved offer from Valley Telecom to the court. The bid follows a new round of negotiations with bidding parties.
    • The new proposal represents a total minimum offer of $5.7M (NIS20.75M), comprised of $3.3M (NIS12M) in 2 payments by Sept. 30, a minimum $1.7M (NIS6.25M) in 4 payments by May 2014, $700K (NIS2.5M) for patents by the end of 2013, and an additional amount based on sale of Alvarion's assets, inventory, and accounts receivable.
    • Under the new offer, Valley Telecom would assume management of Alvarion on Sept. 15. It would also receive newly-issued shares representing 75% of shares outstanding. Current shareholders would be diluted to 10%.
    • The new offer is an improvement from Valley Telecom's previous proposal of a minimum of $3.8M for the company.

  • EPHE

    Philippine economy puts up strong showing in Q2, stocks rise

    • If emerging market growth expectations are being reined in, someone forgot to tell the Philippines. For the fourth quarter in a row, the Philippine economy expands by at least 7%, with GDP growth coming in at 7.5% for Q2, ahead of the 7.3% pace economists were expecting.
    • The Q/Q expansion was 1.4%, well ahead of the 0.8% consensus.
    • "The growth came mainly from consumer and public spending, buttressed by increased investments in fixed capital," a state official said.
    • The government now sees the economy beating GDP growth targets for the year.
    • Philippine stocks (NYSEARCA:EPHE) jump on the news, rising 3.6% in Manila after falling more than 3% for two straight sessions.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM

  • Bank Indonesia raises rates amid market pressure

    • Bank Indonesia steps up to the plate with a 50 bps rate hike for both the reference rate and the overnight deposit facility rate. The benchmark rate is now 7% and the FASBI now sits at 5.25%.
    • The move helped shore up confidence (at least for today) as the rupiah stabilized and Indonesian equities (IDX, EIDO) finished 1.9% higher in Jakarta. Indonesia SmallCap ETF: IDXJ
    • It goes without saying that many market participants will likely remain skeptical of the central bank's ability to anchor the currency as the Fed begins to turn off the spigot. "We believe further rate hikes are needed to restore market confidence," a StanChart analyst tells Bloomberg. "If the rupiah remains weak, there will be more tightening measures," a local fund manager notes.
    • The question of course, is whether further tightening will choke off GDP growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM

  • Asian shares higher as Syria action set for delay

    • Asian shares mostly rise as divisions in the U.S. and U.K. look likely to have delayed military intervention in Syria, which, says Guillaume Dumans of research firm 2Bremans, "is prompting a number of investors to bet on a rebound."
    • Emerging markets that have been hit badly recently are enjoying some respite, although other factors are in play as well, such as the RBI selling dollars to Indian oil companies, a move that has boosted the rupee.
    • Meanwhile, gold and oil, which rose because of the tension, are lower. Gold is -0.7% and oil -0.8%.
    • However, fears that any action, if and when it does come, could cause a wider conflagration, is keeping markets on edge. Iran has already threatened to attack Israel if Syria is hit.
    • Japan +0.9%, Hong Kong +0.8%, China -0.2%, India +2%, Indonesia +1.8%, Malaysia +1%, Thailand +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 AM

  • Rupee rebounds as RBI sells dollars to oil companies

    • The Indian rupee has rebounded from the record low it hit yesterday after the Reserve Bank of India said it would sell dollars to the country's major oil companies.
    • With oil India's biggest import, the action is aimed at removing $400-500M worth of demand a day for the dollar from the spot market and reducing downward pressure on the rupee.
    • Now analysts want to see reform to address India's fiscal and current account deficits, and its slowing growth.
    • Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh is due to address Parliament tomorrow about the economy.
    • The USD-IRN is -1.7% at 67.626, while shares are +1.95% and 10-year bond yields are -16 bps at 8.805%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 AM
